d_description: Drivers have enough knowledge of driving rules and laws as well as driving skills. Safely driving an ambulance to transport patients as quickly as possible to medical facilities for care is a primary part of an ambulance driver’s job.

Drivers have enough knowledge of driving rules and laws as well as driving skills.In situations where the patient requires some level of care before reaching the hospital, such as instances of heavy bleeding or respiratory distress, the ambulance driver provides first aid or administers oxygen.

Drivers have enough knowledge of driving rules and laws as well as driving skills. To keep the ambulance sanitary and germ-free, ambulance drivers thoroughly sanitize the vehicle and remove soiled linens and contaminated supplies.

Drivers have enough knowledge of driving rules and laws as well as driving skills. Ambulance drivers make daily entries into a driving log. This information includes patients’ names and addresses, trip times, mileage, and services performed.

Drivers have enough knowledge of driving rules and laws as well as driving skills. They inspect the ambulance and report any deficiencies for repair. Fuel, oil, transmission fluid, coolant, and wiper fluid levels are checked and topped off if necessary.
